name: Navasana (Boat Pose)
purpose: A balancing posture that activates the abdominal muscles.

name: Vrikshasana (Tree Pose)
purpose: Balance on one foot while stabilizing the body through engaged muscles.

name: Bhujangasana (Cobra Pose)
purpose: A spinal backbend lifting the chest from the ground.

name: Salabhasana (Locust Pose)
purpose: A prone back-strengthening pose lifting legs and chest.
benefits: Strengthens lower back, glutes, and hamstrings

name: Sirsasana (Headstand)
purpose: An inverted balance relying on head and forearm support.

name: Supported Fish Pose
purpose: Chest expands over a bolster or cushion to create a gentle heart opener.
benefits: Releases tension in shoulders and chest
Calms nervous system and reduces anxiety

name: Ardha Uttanasana (Half Forward Fold)
purpose: Halfway lift that creates length through the back and spine.

name: Virabhadrasana II (Warrior II)
purpose: A grounded lunge that energizes the arms and builds stamina.

name: Utkatasana (Chair Pose)
purpose: A squat-like position that builds heat and leg strength.
benefits: Strengthens thighs, glutes, and lower back

name: Anjaneyasana (Low Lunge)
purpose: Deep lunge that releases hips while the back knee rests on the floor.

name: Bakasana – Beginner Arm Balance (Crow Pose)
purpose: Arm balance with knees resting on upper arms while leaning forward.

name: Gomukhasana (Cow Face Pose)
purpose: Knees stacked while arms reach to clasp behind the back.

name: Ardha Matsyendrasana (Spinal Twist)
purpose: Seated twist that massages abdominal organs through rotation.

name: Setu Bandhasana (Bridge Pose)
purpose: A backbend supported by shoulders and feet with lifted hips.
benefits: Expands the chest and heart space

name: Urdhva Mukha Svanasana (Upward Facing Dog)
purpose: Strong backbend lifting chest while thighs hover above the floor.

name: Ardha Pincha Mayurasana (Dolphin Pose)
purpose: Forearm-based inversion that builds shoulder strength.
benefits: Prepares body for inversions like headstand

name: Uttana Shishosana (Puppy Pose)
purpose: Heart-opening stretch between child’s pose and downward dog.
benefits: Lengthens the spine and relieves tension

name: Trikonasana (Triangle Pose)
purpose: A lateral stretch that lengthens both sides of the body.
benefits: Enhances flexibility in the legs and hips

name: Tadasana (Mountain Pose)
purpose: Foundation standing pose that aligns the entire body vertically.

name: Baddha Konasana (Butterfly Pose)
purpose: A seated hip opener with soles of the feet together and knees relaxed outward.

name: Phalakasana (Plank Pose)
purpose: A strong arm-supported posture that stabilizes core muscles.
benefits: Builds endurance in arms and wrists

name: Ananda Balasana (Happy Baby Pose)
purpose: Reclining hip opener with hands holding the feet.

name: Eka Pada Rajakapotasana – Beginner Variation (Pigeon Pose)
purpose: Forward hip opener with one leg extended behind.

name: Viparita Karani (Legs Up the Wall)
purpose: Inverted restorative pose with legs supported up a wall.

name: Matsyasana (Fish Pose)
purpose: Heart-opening backbend performed lying on the back with lifted chest.
benefits: Opens throat and chest to aid breathing

name: Supta Matsyendrasana (Reclined Twist)
purpose: Gentle reclined twist that releases tension from the spine.

name: Dhanurasana (Bow Pose)
purpose: Full-body backbend pulling the legs toward the head while on stomach.

name: Ustrasana (Camel Pose)
purpose: Deep kneeling backbend creating full front-body opening.
benefits: Stretches chest, abdomen, and hip flexors

name: Uttana Prasarita Eka Padasana (Standing Split)
purpose: Forward fold with one leg lifted vertically for balance and stretch.

name: Malasana (Garland Pose)
purpose: Deep squat that increases hip mobility and grounds the body.
benefits: Deeply opens hips and pelvic floor

name: Supta Baddha Konasana (Reclined Bound Angle Pose)
purpose: Reclined restorative hip opener with knees wide and feet together.
benefits: Gently opens hips and inner thighs

name: Alanasana (High Lunge)
purpose: A lifted lunge emphasizing leg strength and alignment.

name: Balasana (Child’s Pose)
purpose: A restorative fold that gently releases the back and mind.
benefits: Eases tension in the lower back and hips

name: Savasana (Corpse Pose)
purpose: Complete rest allowing body and mind to reset.

name: Virabhadrasana I (Warrior I)
purpose: A powerful standing stance focusing on stability and chest expansion.

name: Vasisthasana (Side Plank)
purpose: Arm balance emphasizing oblique and shoulder strength.
